metadata.description: Community-driven marketplace for Claude Code commands and plugins

plugins.name: documentation-generator
plugins.description: Create comprehensive documentation for code, APIs, and projects.

plugins.name: lyra
plugins.description: Lyra - a master-level AI prompt optimization specialist.

plugins.name: analyze-codebase
plugins.description: Generate comprehensive analysis and documentation of entire codebase

plugins.name: update-claudemd
plugins.description: Automatically update CLAUDE.md file based on recent code changes

plugins.name: ultrathink
plugins.description: Use /ultrathink <TASK_DESCRIPTION> to launch a Coordinator Agent that directs four specialist sub-agents—Architect, Research, Coder, and Tester—to analyze, design, implement, and validate your coding task. The process breaks the task into clear steps, gathers insights, and synthesizes a cohesive solution with actionable outputs. Relevant files can be referenced ad-hoc using @ filename syntax.

plugins.name: code-review
plugins.description: Perform a comprehensive code review of recent changes

plugins.name: refractor
plugins.description: Refactor code following best practices and design patterns

plugins.name: code-review-assistant
plugins.description: Get comprehensive code reviews with suggestions for improvements, best practices, and potential issues.

plugins.name: bug-detective
plugins.description: Systematically debug issues with step-by-step troubleshooting approaches.

plugins.name: audit
plugins.description: Perform security audit on codebase

plugins.name: plan
plugins.description: For easy problems, start here. For harder problems, do this after Explore.

plugins.name: claude-desktop-extension
plugins.description: This command provides the context necessary for Claude Code to create the Desktop Extension or .dxt file of an MCP.

plugins.name: optimize
plugins.description: Analyze and optimize code performance

plugins.name: commit
plugins.description: Creates git commits using conventional commit format with appropriate emojis, following project standards and creating descriptive messages that explain the purpose of changes.

plugins.name: explore
plugins.description:
Helps Claude read a planning document and explore related files to get familiar with a topic. Asking Claude to prepare to discuss seems to work better than asking it to prepare to do specific work.

This is followed by Plan, then Execute.

plugins.name: generate-api-docs
plugins.description: Generate API documentation for endpoints

plugins.name: debug-session
plugins.description: Ask Claude Code to help you debug an issue

plugins.name: test-file
plugins.description: Generate comprehensive tests for a specific file

plugins.name: double-check
plugins.description: An easy way to force agent to think again if it's statement that the "Job is done and production ready" is actually done - usually it's not. Thanks to this command you don't have to check after the agent if they did their job.

plugins.name: create-worktrees
plugins.description: Creates git worktrees for all open PRs or specific branches, handling branches with slashes, cleaning up stale worktrees, and supporting custom branch creation for development.

plugins.name: pr-review
plugins.description: Reviews pull request changes to provide feedback, check for issues, and suggest improvements before merging into the main codebase.

plugins.name: update-branch-name
plugins.description: Updates branch names with proper prefixes and formats, enforcing naming conventions, supporting semantic prefixes, and managing remote branch updates.

plugins.name: analyze-issue
plugins.description: Fetches GitHub issue details to create comprehensive implementation specifications, analyzing requirements and planning structured approach with clear implementation steps.

plugins.name: discuss
plugins.description: Collaborative technical discussion with proactive requirements gathering

plugins.name: bug-fix
plugins.description: Streamlines bug fixing by creating a GitHub issue first, then a feature branch for implementing and thoroughly testing the solution before merging.

plugins.name: openapi-expert
plugins.description: Use this agent to update, synchronize, or validate the OpenAPI specification (openapi.yml) against the actual REST API implementation. This includes adding new endpoints, updating request/response schemas, fixing discrepancies between the spec and code, or ensuring complete API documentation coverage.

plugins.name: create-pr
plugins.description: Streamlines pull request creation by handling the entire workflow: creating a new branch, committing changes, formatting modified files with Biome, and submitting the PR.

plugins.name: create-pull-request
plugins.description: Provides comprehensive PR creation guidance with GitHub CLI, enforcing title conventions, following template structure, and offering concrete command examples with best practices.

plugins.name: fix-github-issue
plugins.description: Analyzes and fixes GitHub issues using a structured approach with GitHub CLI for issue details, implementing necessary code changes, running tests, and creating proper commit messages.

plugins.name: fix-issue
plugins.description: Addresses GitHub issues by taking issue number as parameter, analyzing context, implementing solution, and testing/validating the fix for proper integration.

plugins.name: fix-pr
plugins.description: Fetches and fixes unresolved PR comments by automatically retrieving feedback, addressing reviewer concerns, making targeted code improvements, and streamlining the review process.

plugins.name: husky
plugins.description: Sets up and manages Husky Git hooks by configuring pre-commit hooks, establishing commit message standards, integrating with linting tools, and ensuring code quality on commits.

plugins.name: 2-commit-fast
plugins.description: Automates git commit process by selecting the first suggested message, generating structured commits with consistent formatting while skipping manual confirmation and removing Claude co-Contributorship footer

plugins.name: pr-issue-resolve
plugins.description: this is to analyze the PRs and solve the requested changes in them

plugins.name: github-issue-fix
plugins.description: This is a detailed way you can analyze the GitHub issues and let Claude handle them in best possible way.
